channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Efficient and Robust 2D-to-BEV Representation Learning via Geometry-guided Kernel Transformer
item.description: GKT leverages the geometric priors to guide the transformer to focus on discriminative regions and unfolds kernel features to generate BEV representation.

item.title: VITA: Video Instance Segmentation via Object Token Association
item.description: Specifically, we use an image object detector as a means of distilling object-specific contexts into object tokens.

item.title: Explicit Regularization in Overparametrized Models via Noise Injection
item.description: Injecting noise within gradient descent has several desirable features.

item.title: DiSparse: Disentangled Sparsification for Multitask Model Compression
item.description: We analyzed the pruning masks generated with DiSparse and observed strikingly similar sparse network architecture identified by each task even before the training starts.

item.title: Neural Prompt Search
item.description: The size of vision models has grown exponentially over the last few years, especially after the emergence of Vision Transformer.

item.title: BigVGAN: A Universal Neural Vocoder with Large-Scale Training
item.description: Despite recent progress in generative adversarial network(GAN)-based vocoders, where the model generates raw waveform conditioned on mel spectrogram, it is still challenging to synthesize high-fidelity audio for numerous speakers across varied recording environments.

item.title: Towards Layer-wise Image Vectorization
item.description: Image rasterization is a mature technique in computer graphics, while image vectorization, the reverse path of rasterization, remains a major challenge.

item.title: Distillation Decision Tree
item.description: With well-known advantages in interpretation, decision tree is a competitive candidate of the transparent model.

item.title: A Relational Intervention Approach for Unsupervised Dynamics Generalization in Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
item.description: However, because environments are not labelled, the extracted information inevitably contains redundant information unrelated to the dynamics in transition segments and thus fails to maintain a crucial property of $Z$: $Z$ should be similar in the same environment and dissimilar in different ones.

item.title: Analytical Composition of Differential Privacy via the Edgeworth Accountant
item.description: Many modern machine learning algorithms are composed of simple private algorithms; thus, an increasingly important problem is to efficiently compute the overall privacy loss under composition.

item.title: PointNeXt: Revisiting PointNet++ with Improved Training and Scaling Strategies
item.description: In this work, we revisit the classical PointNet++ through a systematic study of model training and scaling strategies, and offer two major contributions.

item.title: Local Spatiotemporal Representation Learning for Longitudinally-consistent Neuroimage Analysis
item.description: Recent self-supervised advances in medical computer vision exploit global and local anatomical self-similarity for pretraining prior to downstream tasks such as segmentation.

item.title: On Margins and Generalisation for Voting Classifiers
item.description: We study the generalisation properties of majority voting on finite ensembles of classifiers, proving margin-based generalisation bounds via the PAC-Bayes theory.

item.title: Neo-GNNs: Neighborhood Overlap-aware Graph Neural Networks for Link Prediction
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have been widely applied to various fields for learning over graph-structured data.

item.title: SAR Despeckling using a Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Model
item.description: The despeckled image is recovered by a reverse process which iteratively predicts the added noise using a noise predictor which is conditioned on the speckled image.

item.title: STIP: A SpatioTemporal Information-Preserving and Perception-Augmented Model for High-Resolution Video Prediction
item.description: To solve the information loss problem, the proposed model aims to preserve the spatiotemporal information for videos during the feature extraction and the state transitions, respectively.

item.title: Language Identification for Austronesian Languages
item.description: This paper provides language identification models for low- and under-resourced languages in the Pacific region with a focus on previously unavailable Austronesian languages.

item.title: Accurate Node Feature Estimation with Structured Variational Graph Autoencoder
item.description: Given a graph with partial observations of node features, how can we estimate the missing features accurately?

item.title: Graph Attention Multi-Layer Perceptron
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have achieved great success in many graph-based applications.

item.title: Beyond the Imitation Game: Quantifying and extrapolating the capabilities of language models
item.description: BIG-bench focuses on tasks that are believed to be beyond the capabilities of current language models.

item.title: Xplique: A Deep Learning Explainability Toolbox
item.description: Today's most advanced machine-learning models are hardly scrutable.

item.title: FOAM: A Follower-aware Speaker Model For Vision-and-Language Navigation
item.description: The speaker-follower models have proven to be effective in vision-and-language navigation, where a speaker model is used to synthesize new instructions to augment the training data for a follower navigation model.

item.title: CFA: Coupled-hypersphere-based Feature Adaptation for Target-Oriented Anomaly Localization
item.description: In addition, this paper points out the negative effects of biased features of pre-trained CNNs and emphasizes the importance of the adaptation to the target dataset.

item.title: Crosslinguistic word order variation reflects evolutionary pressures of dependency and information locality
item.description: Using data from 80 languages in 17 language families and phylogenetic modeling, we demonstrate that languages evolve to balance these pressures, such that word order change is accompanied by change in the frequency distribution of the syntactic structures which speakers communicate to maintain overall efficiency.

item.title: An FPGA-based Solution for Convolution Operation Acceleration
item.description: Hardware-based acceleration is an extensive attempt to facilitate many computationally-intensive mathematics operations.

item.title: Unlearning Protected User Attributes in Recommendations with Adversarial Training
item.description: We conduct experiments on the MovieLens-1M and LFM-2b-DemoBias datasets, and evaluate the effectiveness of the bias mitigation method based on the inability of external attackers in revealing the users' gender information from the model.

item.title: AGConv: Adaptive Graph Convolution on 3D Point Clouds
item.description: In this paper, we propose Adaptive Graph Convolution (AGConv) for wide applications of point cloud analysis.

item.title: Large Loss Matters in Weakly Supervised Multi-Label Classification
item.description: In this work, we first regard unobserved labels as negative labels, casting the WSML task into noisy multi-label classification.

item.title: Neural Diffusion Processes
item.description: Gaussian processes provide an elegant framework for specifying prior and posterior distributions over functions.

item.title: Generative Myocardial Motion Tracking via Latent Space Exploration with Biomechanics-informed Prior
item.description: In contrast to most existing approaches which impose explicit generic regularization such as smoothness, in this work we propose a novel method that can implicitly learn an application-specific biomechanics-informed prior and embed it into a neural network-parameterized transformation model.

item.title: Disentangled Ontology Embedding for Zero-shot Learning
item.description: In this paper, we focus on ontologies for augmenting ZSL, and propose to learn disentangled ontology embeddings guided by ontology properties to capture and utilize more fine-grained class relationships in different aspects.

item.title: Sparse Fusion Mixture-of-Experts are Domain Generalizable Learners
item.description: To this end, we propose Sparse Fusion Mixture-of-Experts (SF-MoE), which incorporates sparsity and fusion mechanisms into the MoE framework to keep the model both sparse and predictive.

item.title: Blind Face Restoration: Benchmark Datasets and a Baseline Model
item.description: To address this problem, we first synthesize two blind face restoration benchmark datasets called EDFace-Celeb-1M (BFR128) and EDFace-Celeb-150K (BFR512).

item.title: SYNERgy between SYNaptic consolidation and Experience Replay for general continual learning
item.description: Continual learning (CL) in the brain is facilitated by a complex set of mechanisms.

item.title: Mathematical model bridges disparate timescales of lifelong learning
item.description: Our model connects previously disparate timescales -- and the subdisciplines that typically study each timescale in isolation -- to offer a unified account of the timecourse of skill acquisition.

item.title: Controlling strokes in fast neural style transfer using content transforms
item.description: To demonstrate the real-world applicability of our approach, we present StyleTune, a mobile app for interactive editing of neural style transfers at multiple levels of control.

item.title: FedHPO-B: A Benchmark Suite for Federated Hyperparameter Optimization
item.description: Due to this uniqueness, existing HPO benchmarks no longer satisfy the need to compare HPO methods in the FL setting.

item.title: Towards Self-supervised and Weight-preserving Neural Architecture Search
item.description: In this work, we propose the self-supervised and weight-preserving neural architecture search (SSWP-NAS) as an extension of the current NAS framework by allowing the self-supervision and retaining the concomitant weights discovered during the search stage.

item.title: SCAMPS: Synthetics for Camera Measurement of Physiological Signals
item.description: The use of cameras and computational algorithms for noninvasive, low-cost and scalable measurement of physiological (e. g., cardiac and pulmonary) vital signs is very attractive.

item.title: Dual-Distribution Discrepancy for Anomaly Detection in Chest X-Rays
item.description: During training, module A takes both known normal and unlabeled images as inputs, capturing anomalous features from unlabeled images in some way, while module B models the distribution of only known normal images.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning of 3D Scene Flow from Monocular Camera
item.description: Unsupervised learning of scene flow in this paper mainly consists of two parts: (i) depth estimation and camera pose estimation, and (ii) scene flow estimation based on four different loss functions.

item.title: Designing Reinforcement Learning Algorithms for Digital Interventions: Pre-implementation Guidelines
item.description: Online reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms are increasingly used to personalize digital interventions in the fields of mobile health and online education.

item.title: pFL-Bench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Personalized Federated Learning
item.description: Personalized Federated Learning (pFL) has gained increasing attention in recent years due to its success in handling the statistical heterogeneity of FL clients via utilizing and deploying distinct local models.

item.title: Autoregressive Perturbations for Data Poisoning
item.description: Unfortunately, existing methods require knowledge of both the target architecture and the complete dataset so that a surrogate network can be trained, the parameters of which are used to generate the attack.

item.title: Sampling-based techniques for designing school boundaries
item.description: Motivated by these recent developments, we develop a set of similar sampling techniques for designing school boundaries based on the flip proposal.

item.title: Wavelet Regularization Benefits Adversarial Training
item.description: Since adversarial vulnerability can be regarded as a high-frequency phenomenon, it is essential to regulate the adversarially-trained neural network models in the frequency domain.

item.title: Metric Based Few-Shot Graph Classification
item.description: In this work, we tackle the problem of few-shot graph classification, showing that equipping a simple distance metric learning baseline with a state-of-the-art graph embedder allows to obtain competitive results on the task. While the simplicity of the architecture is enough to outperform more complex ones, it also allows straightforward additions.

item.title: Proactively Reducing the Hate Intensity of Online Posts via Hate Speech Normalization
item.description: Curbing online hate speech has become the need of the hour; however, a blanket ban on such activities is infeasible for several geopolitical and cultural reasons.

item.title: Unsupervised Deformable Image Registration with Absent Correspondences in Pre-operative and Post-Recurrence Brain Tumor MRI Scans
item.description: Registration of pre-operative and post-recurrence brain images is often needed to evaluate the effectiveness of brain gliomas treatment.

item.title: Latent Boundary-guided Adversarial Training
item.description: Adversarial training is proved to be the most effective strategy that injects adversarial examples into model training to improve the robustness of DNN models to adversarial attacks.
